result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Crystal C. Matthews

defendant.name: Matthews, Crystal C.
defendant.address: 136 Judson Drive - Apt G, Beaver Dam, WI 53916

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
15CF414 and 16CF32.  Defendant Crystal C. Matthews in court, in custody with attorney Greg Ernest Vollan.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Vollan files plea forms/reviews stipulation.  DEF will be pleading to CT 1 in 16CF32 with CT 2 to be dismissed/read in,; also 15CF414 will be dismissed/read in.  PQWOR filed/reviewed with DEF.  Court reviews charges/penalties with DEF.  DEF enters no contest plea.  Court questions DEF.  Court finds factual basis.  Court finds plea was made FVKI and accepts plea and finds DEF guilty.  State heard/reviews history.  Parties agree with total of 128 days jail credit.  Atty Vollan heard.  DEF makes statement.  Court heard/orders:  DEF to be released from DCJ

W/H Sentence
2 Years Probation w/Conditions
Court Costs
AODA w/Follow Thru
Maintain Absolute Sobriety/Posses
No Bars
DNA Sample
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 12, 2016 at 10:30 am.
NOH to defendant sent to DCDF
Telephone scheduling conference on May 23, 2016 at 11:15 am.

Order on Arraignment

Preliminary hearing at 03-03-2016 08:30 am

Called cases 15CF404 and 15CF414. Defendant Crystal C. Matthews in court, in custody with attorney Jessica Marie Moeller.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court heard, all parties have received copy of report, no other evidence entered. Court heard, finds def competent.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Competency hearing at 02-17-2016 09:00 am

Defendant Crystal C. Matthews in court, in custody with attorney Jessica Marie Moeller.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Moeller heard on argument for bond modification, requests signature bond or possibly $100. Atty Thompson heard on argument. Atty Moeller heard in response. Court heard, motion is denied, bail remains $500.
NOH for Bail Bond hearing for defendant sent to DCDF
Hearing at 01-21-2016 02:00 pm
inmate request slip

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

(12:45) Defendant Crystal C. Matthews in custody via video with attorney Ramneek Singh Button (will appoint).  Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Button requests competency evaluation; Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. State heard on bond, Cash requested; Atty. Button response; Competency hearing to be set; Court sets $500.00 CASH Bond with conditions:   The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety   and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.
State notes that competency should also apply to 15CF404, PH removed in that case
